We have IE 6.0, and I was able to get there. Try just http://fudge.com

have your browser set to accept cookies? Or maybe reduce your security
level for that site? Just grasping at straws, I'm not a computer tech or
anything. <g>

Todd

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] hair dying
messages.msgSnippet: ... Depends on how dark your natural colour is. My normal hair colour is very dark brown so I do lighten it first in order to acheive the bright purple or pink
messages.messageBody:
On 12 Sep 02, at 14:37, tinkiechelle1@... wrote:

> hey shyrley
> your a woman after my own heart. can you tell me more about this
> hair dye.
> i have been wanting to streak mine pink but don't want to bleach it
> out white to do it. so you have to do that with this type? tina
>
Depends on how dark your natural colour is. My normal hair colour
is very dark brown so I do lighten it first in order to acheive the
bright purple or pink that I'm after. Most crazy colours are like that
unfortunately.
Yesterday I dyed my hair blue-black. Haven't decided if I like it yet.
I'm pale anyway and I'm wondering if it makes me look ill but then,
who cares :-)

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] hair dying
messages.msgSnippet: I have done it! It only really works on very blond hair. Make a paste with a little water and leave it on as long as you can stand it. It fades away slowly but
messages.messageBody:
I have done it! It only really works on very blond hair. Make a paste
with a little water and leave it on as long as you can stand it. It
fades away slowly but can work well. Hope that helps, Jane :-)

P.S. When my boys were little they thought Kool-Aid was hair dye and
were shocked to see a person mixing it up and feeding it to their kids.
LOL

From: Jon and Rue Kream [mailto:skreams@...]

Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] hair dying

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] hair dying
messages.msgSnippet: ... I have dyed my oldest son s hair twice in the past year.  At the end of december I braided his hair into many braids, bleached and dyed the ends red, blue,
messages.messageBody:
>Thanks Tina and Nora. dd wants to dye the ends of her hair blue. ~Rue
>
I have dyed my oldest son's hair twice in the past year. At the end of
december I braided his hair into many braids, bleached and dyed the ends
red, blue, green and purple. A few weeks ago, I bleached all of his hair
and dyed it all fire engine red. I used some dye that is available here in
Canada. I have recently heard of a place to get dye that will last better,
it might be fudge.
If your daughter has dark hair you will have to bleach it first or the
colours just don't show up much.
I have used koolaid to dye yarn with lots of success.
Susanna

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] hair dying
messages.msgSnippet: On Wed, 11 Sep 2002 17:21:43 -0400 Shyrley ... I ve heard good things about fudge, although the website is hopeless is you re still on dialup. We ve used
messages.messageBody:
On Wed, 11 Sep 2002 17:21:43 -0400 "Shyrley"
<shyrley.williams@...> writes:
>
> I use the dyes from fudge.com

I've heard good things about fudge, although the website is hopeless is
you're still on dialup. We've used Special Effects, from www.goodgoth.com
or www.amphigory.com. Rain has done blue, green, and pink, but I don't
remember the exact shades.

I did my hair black for a few years (it's naturally somewhere between
dark blonde and light brown). It looked cool, very Irish, but upkeep was
a hassle.

dar

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] hair dying
messages.msgSnippet: ... I haven t done it myself, but know folks who have. Kool aid does not come out once it s in. Especially red. Life is good. ~Mary
messages.messageBody:
>>Does anyone have experience with using koolaid to dye hair? ~Rue>>

I haven't done it myself, but know folks who have. Kool aid does not come
out once it's in. Especially red.

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] hair dying
messages.msgSnippet: we did that alot in high school. you just mix the kool aid and water without the sugar and pour it on your hair. the lighter you hair the better the color will
messages.messageBody:
we did that alot in high school. you just mix the kool aid and water without
the sugar and pour it on your hair. the lighter you hair the better the color
will be.my hair has always been dark red and i used purple to tint it and it
worked great, my friend was a blond and died hers every color in the rainbow.
it will wash out but as b4 the lighter your hair the longer it will take
because you will have more color.
tina
